revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== {{suffix|en|xylophonic|ally}} ===Adverb=== {{en-adv|-}} # {{lb|en|rare}} As if by a [[xylophone]]. #* '''1919''', ''The Judge: Volume 77'' #*: A fox trot idyl of the Orient, '''xylophonically''' told and played in excellent tempo. #* {{quote-book|en|year=2001|author=Dean Koontz|title=From the Corner of His Eye|passage={{...}} while the dishes on the bed tray clinked '''xylophonically''' against one another.}} #* '''2007''', Ronald Blythe, ''Out of the Valley: Another Year at Wormingford'' (page 16) #*: Alf re-lays them two by two, first levelling their sandy beds, and I listen to them chinking '''xylophonically''' as he locks them into each other.
